meanings.definition: A person who believes in or advocates for multilateralism.
meanings.sent1: Many multilateralists work together to promote cooperation among countries.
meanings.sent2: The multilateralists at the conference discussed ways to improve international relations.
meanings.sent3: The multilateralists organized a potluck to show how countries can work together for a common goal.
meanings.sent4: She was like a multilateralist, always seeking harmony and collaboration in her interactions.
meanings.sent5: The group of multilateralists stood united, each one representing a different nation but working towards a shared vision.

meanings.definition: Involving or participated in by more than two nations or parties.
meanings.sent1: The multilateralists agreement was signed by several countries to address global issues.
meanings.sent2: The treaty was a multilateralists effort to promote peace and stability.
meanings.sent3: The multilateralists trade deal brought together nations in a beneficial exchange.
meanings.sent4: Her approach to problem-solving was like a multilateralists negotiation, considering the interests of all parties involved.
meanings.sent5: The multilateralists summit aimed to foster collaboration and understanding among diverse nations.
